Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Seed non-specific lipid transfer protein-like (ns-LTP; Plants)
Sequence Information.Family: Belongs to the plant LTP family
Sequence Information.Target Organism: Fungi:Alternaria brassicola (MUCL 20297) (IC50=48 µg/mL), Ascochyta pisi (MUCL 20164) (IC50=41 µg/mL), Botrytis cinerea (MUCL 30158) (IC50=45 µg/mL), Colletotrichum lindemuthianum (MUCL 9577) (IC50=25 µg/mL), Fusarium culmorum (IMI 180420) (IC50=20 µg/mL), Fusarium oxysporum f. sp. lycopersici (MUCL 909) (IC50=54 µg/mL), Fusarium oxysporum f. sp. pisi (IMI 236441) (IC50=58 µg/mL), Nectria haematococca (Collection Van Etten 26022) (IC50=100 µg/mL), Phoma betae (MUCL 9916) (IC50=18 µg/mL), Pyricularia oryzae (MUCL 30166) (IC50=10 µg/mL), Trichoderma hamatum (MUCL 29736) (IC50=30 µg/mL), Verticillium dahliae (MUCL 6963) (IC50=7 µg/mL).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Function: Plant non-specific lipid-transfer proteins transfer phospholipids as well as galactolipids across membranes. May play a role in wax or cutin deposition in the cell walls of expanding epidermal cells and certain secretory tissues. This isoform inhibits the hyphal growth of several fungi in vitro.

Literature.Title: In vitro antifungal activity of a radish (Raphanus sativus L.) seed protein homologous to non-specific lipid transfer proteins.
Literature.Author: Terras FR, Goderis IJ, Van Leuven F, Vanderleyden J, Cammue BP, Broekaert WF.
